channel.title: mind the gap
channel.description: This blog is a collection of tips and tricks found elsewhere, so its posts are about things perhaps I would need someday. Maybe you find something useful here too!

item.title: Human hacking and Sneaky Pete
item.description: Sneaky Pete is an Amazon Original series. It follows a released convict who adopts the identity of his cell mate in order to avoid his past life. The IMDB score for the series is 8.5, but I encourage you to review the scores for each episode - each new episode gets a higher score, with the final one getting an impressive 9.5! Try Amazon Prime for free during 30 days and enjoy it!

item.title: MongoDB best security practices
item.description: Today I have read about the detention of people related to the Phineas Fisher’s hacks. In such news article I found a link to his latest manifesto at pastebin.

item.title: Reset MySQL root password
item.description: For testing purposes I have a Linux virtual machine running MySQL, so whenever I check any given software requiring MySQL, I just start such VM. However, last time I run it, I forgot the MySQL root’s password - yes, I am human - so I was unable to create any new users.

item.title: Red Team Field Manual
item.description: Just found my copy yesterday. Quite handy.

item.title: Password management
item.description: How to choose a good password. Each time I read something like that I remember a great comic stripe at xkcd.com.

item.title: Mounting drive images
item.description: Recently I read about how to Mount a Raspberry Pi File System Image. The described procedure there can be applied to any drive image as long as it is not a virtual drive image (a dd image from a SD card is used there). Luckily, many time ago I found the instructions for virtual drive images.

item.title: Welcome to the gap!
item.description: Hi there! It took a long time, but finally I realised the best way to start a project is to start a small task — check out Kadavy’s post about starting small habits.
